solution_line_template: There are {num_ladies_in_group} ladies total in the group. They all walk {group_daily_miles} miles a day for {num_days_walked} days so {group_daily_miles}*{num_days_walked} = {group_total_miles} miles

Jamie walks an additional {jamie_additional_daily_miles} miles per day for {num_days_walked} days so {jamie_additional_daily_miles}*{num_days_walked} = <<{jamie_additional_daily_miles}*{num_days_walked}={jamie_additional_total_miles}>>{jamie_additional_total_miles} miles
Sue walks half the distance of Jamie so {jamie_additional_total_miles}/{sue_half_divisor} = <<{jamie_additional_total_miles}/{sue_half_divisor}={sue_total_miles}>>{sue_total_miles} miles
